Cypress Resource Abstraction (abstraction-resource)
Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions
Resource Abstraction

General Description

Basic abstraction layer for dealing with resources.

Data Structures

struct  cy_filesystem_resource_handle_t
 
struct  cy_resource_handle_t
 
union  cy_resource_handle_t.val

struct cy_resource_handle_t
Data Fields
cy_resource_location_t location

resource location

unsigned long size

resource size

union cy_resource_handle_t val

low-level handle (type varies depending on resource storage location)

◆ cy_resource_handle_t.val

union cy_resource_handle_t.val
Data Fields
cy_filesystem_resource_handle_t fs

handle for resource in filesystem

const uint8_t * mem_data

handle for resource in internal memory

void * external_storage_context

handle for resource in external storage

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 0))

Error code for when the specified resource operation is not valid.

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_UNAVAILABLE

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_UNAVAILABLE   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 1))

Error indicating that memory for the specified resource could not be allocated.

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_OFFSET

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_OFFSET   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 2))

Error code for when the specified resource offset is not valid for the specified resource.

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_OPEN

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_OPEN   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 3))

Error code for when the specified resource can not be opened for reading.

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_SEEK

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_SEEK   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 4))

Error code for when the specified location can not be accessed in the specified resource.

◆ CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_READ

#define CY_RSLT_RSC_ERROR_READ   (CY_RSLT_CREATE(CY_RSLT_TYPE_ERROR, CY_RSLT_MODULE_ABSTRACTION_RESOURCE, 5))

Error code for when the specified resource can not be read.

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ cy_resource_location_t

enum cy_resource_location_t

Different types of memory that the resources can be stored in.

Enumerator
CY_RESOURCE_IN_MEMORY 

resource location in memory

CY_RESOURCE_IN_FILESYSTEM 

resource location in filesystem

CY_RESOURCE_IN_EXTERNAL_STORAGE 

resource location in external storage

Function Documentation

◆ cy_resource_get_block_size()

cy_rslt_t cy_resource_get_block_size ( const cy_resource_handle_t *  handle,
uint32_t *  size 
)

return the block size for the resource

Parameters
handlehandle to a resource
sizepointer to a uint32_t to receive the size
Returns
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if the size was found, otherwise an error

uint32_t *  size

return the total size for the resource

Parameters

sizepointer to a uint32_t to receive the size
Returns

◆ cy_resource_get_block_count()

cy_rslt_t cy_resource_get_block_count ( const cy_resource_handle_t *  handle,
uint32_t *  blocks 
)

return the total number of blocks that exist for the resource

Parameters
handlehandle to a resource
blockspointer to a uint32_t to receive the count
Returns
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if the count was found, otherwise an error

◆ cy_resource_read()

cy_rslt_t cy_resource_read ( const cy_resource_handle_t *  handle,
uint32_t  blockno,
uint8_t **  buffer,
uint32_t *  size 
)

read data from a resource

Parameters
handlethe handle to the resource
blocknothe block number of the data from the resource
bufferpointer to receive buffer address from resource. The buffer must be freed when done. Eg: free(buffer)
sizelocation to receive the size of the block read
Returns
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if data read, otherwise an error

◆ cy_resource_readonly_memory()

cy_rslt_t cy_resource_readonly_memory ( const cy_resource_handle_t *  handle,
const uint8_t **  buffer,
uint32_t *  size 
)

optimized version of read for resources stored in memory

See also
CY_RESOURCE_IN_MEMORY
Parameters
handlethe handle to the resource
bufferpointer to receive buffer address from resource. This does NOT need to be freed.
sizelocation to receive the size of the block read
Returns
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if data read, otherwise an error
